title: Teenager injured during quadruple shooting in north St. Louis
content:
NORTH ST. LOUIS (KMOV.com) -
A teenager was among four people who were shot in north St. Louis Tuesday night.
A 21-year-old woman, 42-year-old woman, 23-year-old man, and 15-year-old boy were traveling southbound in the 1100 block of Riverview in the Baden neighborhood when a burgundy Hyundai SUV pulled alongside them at a high rate of speed around 8:50 p.m.
The two suspects inside the burgundy vehicle began shooting at the victim’s vehicle, hitting all four of the occupants.
The 21-year-old woman was listed in critical, but stable condition after she sustained gunshot wounds to the face and chest. The 42-year-old woman sustained a gunshot to the arm was listed as stable. The 23-year-old man was struck in the back of the head and listed as stable. The 15-year-old hit in the leg and listed as stable.
The victims told police they recognized the male suspects, ages 25 and 26, from a previous incident. Police said they have identified the suspects and placed them as wanted. Authorities have not released the identities of the suspects.
